name: SocketResponse
documentation:
Represents a response to a {@link SocketRequest} sent over a WebSocket session.

Each {@code SocketResponse} is associated with a {@code requestId} that matches it to the originating request. The response either contains a successful result as a {@link JsonNode}, or an error message indicating failure.

{@code SocketResponse} instances are typically generated via the static factory methods:

  • {@link #success(long, Object)} — wraps a successful response value
  • {@link #error(long, String)} — represents an error condition for the given request

Note: In most cases, {@code SocketRequest}s and {@code SocketResponse}s are created and handled automatically by the {@link SocketSession}. Developers working within a Fluxzero system typically do not need to construct them manually. However, understanding their format becomes important when integrating with non-Fluxzero systems—such as a browser-based UI—over WebSocket. In such scenarios, this class defines the structure of a response expected by a Fluxzero client. @see SocketRequest @see SocketSession#sendRequest(Request, java.time.Duration)

fields.name: error
fields.documentation: Optional error message if the request failed.

fields.name: requestId
fields.documentation: Identifier of the original request that this response corresponds to.

fields.name: result
fields.documentation: JSON-encoded response value, or {@code null} in case of an error.

methods.name: deserialize
error
isValid
methods.documentation:
Indicates whether this socket response is valid.

A response is considered valid if it has a positive {@code requestId} and contains either a result or an error message. @return {@code true} if valid, {@code false} otherwise

methods.name: success
